pullRequest.body:
Most of the API can be additivised smoothly. The lemma names didn't match the naming convention. Some proofs were harder than necessary because of the suboptimal definition of `IsBlock` as `âˆ€ _, _ âˆ¨ _` rather than `âˆ€ _, _ â†’ _`.

From LeanCamCombi

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Is there any way to unify this with the material in `GroupTheory/GroupAction/Blocks`?

> Is there any way to unify this with the material in `GroupTheory/GroupAction/Blocks`?

Yes indeed there is, but the API felt suboptimal to use so here's a rewrite instead ðŸ˜‡

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17907~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
I had a look at the files. I have no comment.

Thanks for your comment Antoine!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11464183215/job/31899793020)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11464183215/job/31899793728)

```suggestion
```
Can you also prove the version for right cosets?

This looks like the kind of statement that might also be nice unfolded: if `a != b` then `Disjoint (a â€¢ s) (b â€¢ s)`. That way, it's easy to access the disjointness (eg for rewriting with lemmas which ask for a disjointness assumption) without going through Set.range and PairwiseDisjoint and Function.onFun. (Of course the version with PairwiseDisjoint should still exist!)

> if `a != b` then `Disjoint (a â€¢ s) (b â€¢ s)`

... except that it's false! It's really important that we take the range before talking about disjointness

> Can you also prove the version for right cosets?

I thought my statement already covered it, but it seems like it can't: The left version must use `smul_coe_set` while the right version must use `op_smul_coe_set`
Let's separate the changes to this file from the changes in other files into two separate PRs.
Split off to #17906 and #17907

```suggestion
-- TODO: This proof is redoing a special case of `MulAction.IsInvariantBlock.isBlock`. Can we move
```

This makes it seem like making `g` implicit was a bad idea - there are no cases where you saved an underscore (or anything else, for that matter), but there is a case where you needed to specify it explicitly. What's the justification for this?
Actually I already had reverted the implicitness change. Just forgot to revert this part of the diff
Great!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(GroupAction/Blocks): additivise, fix names, golf API
